definition: to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Despite all this, GE failed to save its top-notch credit rating.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，GE还丢掉了长久以来了最高信用等级。

sentences.english: I'll get old, but not lose first naive.
sentences.chinese: 我会越来越老成，却不会丢掉最初的天真。

sentences.english: The old worker would not cast off the ragged coat that reminded him of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 老工人不愿丢掉那件使他回忆起过去岁月的破褂子。

sentences.english: It does not matter whether he fails an exam or miss a sale.
sentences.chinese: 一次考试的失败或是丢掉了一点销售额都没有关系。

sentences.english: Economists who ignore the recent rise in unemployment deserve to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 忽视最近失业增加经济学家们，活该丢掉饭碗。

sentences.english: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away.
sentences.chinese: 若是右手叫你跌倒，就砍下来丢掉。

sentences.english: The lotus blooms in the sight of the sun， and loses all that it has.
sentences.chinese: 荷花在日中开放，丢掉了自己的一切所有。

sentences.english: You know the old saying, use it or lose it.
sentences.chinese: 你知道一句老话，使用它或者丢掉它。

sentences.english: He longed to throw off the mask of respectability.
sentences.chinese: 他渴望丢掉那副道貌岸然的伪装。

sentences.english: The child is grown, and puts away childish things. childhood is the kingdom where nobody dies.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子在长大的过程中，慢慢地丢掉幼稚的东西。

sentences.english: Just be careful and don�t throw away the old ones.
sentences.chinese: 只是要小心，而且先不要丢掉拆下的旧电池。

sentences.english: Mr. Wahl said the loss of his job was still sinking in.
sentences.chinese: 瓦尔先生说，工作的丢掉仍旧让他苦恼。

sentences.english: But my apprehensions were really that I should miscarry .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以丢掉所有关于联盟安全的忧虑。

sentences.english: You should trash those silly ideas as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你应该尽快丢掉那些糊涂想法。

sentences.english: By criticizing her boss, she risked losing her job.
sentences.chinese: 批评老板使她冒丢掉工作之险。

sentences.english: First the garrison lost the airstrip, which meant it could only be reinforced by parachute.
sentences.chinese: 先是守备部队丢掉了机场跑道，这意味着要加强空投。

definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
